intro: Alaticaulia tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis alate caudate, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Madagascar. It is characterized by its unique, winged stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Its leaves are typically narrow and elongated, with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Alaticaulia tovarensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
